alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 25 at 2:49PM EDT until September 25 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Statement, up to 1 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the second Coastal Flood Statement, up to 1 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Statement, until 11 PM EDT this evening. For the second Coastal Flood Statement, from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline this afternoon into evening and Tuesday afternoon into evening. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 6 ft will result in beach erosion with minor damage possible to dune structures at Orient Point. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
